sentence.Network_en: The country had confounded the pundits by electing a fourth-term Tory government.
sentence.Network_cn: 该国国民连续四次选举托利党来执掌政府，这令专家们困惑不已。

sentence.Network_en: Tory-bashing or Labour-bashing will not be enough to shift bored, suspicious voters.
sentence.Network_cn: 抨击保守党或工党并不足以改变那些心生厌倦、心存怀疑的选民的态度。

sentence.Network_en: Shopkeepers would once have been pillars of the Tory establishment.
sentence.Network_cn: 商店店主一度本该成为保守党统治集团的重要支柱。

PerfectNetExp.abs: liberalising the tory line on gay rights-the party had previously supported section 28 , a law which made it hard for schools to teach pupils about homosexuality-was part of his strategy .在同性恋权利上放宽保守党的方针该党之前支持政府法案第28章节，一项使得学校难以向学生们讲述关于同性恋的法律是他策略的一部分。

entry.tran: (英国)托利党党员的，保守党党员的
entry.def: In Britain, a Tory politician or voter is a member of or votes for the Conservative Party.

example.ex: ...the former Tory Party chairman, Chris Patten.
…the constituency with the largest Tory majority in the country.
example.tran: 该国托利党多数票的票数居首的选区

means.word_mean: 1. an American who favored the British side during the American Revolution
2. a supporter of traditional political and social institutions against the forces of reform; a political conservative
